meanings.def: waste food, paper, etc. that you throw away
examples: Don't forget to take out the garbage.
During the crisis, garbage was not collected.
Someone just dumped their garbage into my backyard.
There was garbage strewn around everywhere.
We picked up all the garbage we could find.
The canal is full of garbage and bits of wood.
You could see the rats moving about on the garbage dump.

meanings.def: a place or container where waste food, paper, etc. can be placed

examples: ‘You mean you believe all that garbage?’ he said.
It's mostly the same old garbage.
The second series was a piece of garbage.
She just watches garbage on TV all day.
There was a lot of garbage reported about me in the newspapers.

meanings.def: used to express the idea that if wrong or poor quality data, material or effort is put into something, wrong or poor quality results will come out of it

idioms.def: used to express the idea that if wrong or poor quality data, material or effort is put into something, wrong or poor quality results will come out of it
